explains: n. 微弱的闪光，瞬息的一现
v. 闪烁，隐约地闪现（gleam 的 ing 形式）

sentences.en: Gleaming ripples cut the lake's surface.
sentences.cn: 闪着微光的涟漪打破了湖面的平静。

sentences.en: To gaze upon the same planet in space, or at the same glowworm gleaming in the grass;
sentences.cn: 凝望天空中的同一颗行星，或草丛中闪烁的同一只萤火虫；

sentences.en: The house was gleaming with fresh white paint.
sentences.cn: 房子刚刷过白漆，显得光洁明亮。
